meanings.definition: A shout of approval or encouragement.
meanings.sent1: The crowd erupted in bravos when the hero saved the day.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the bravos from the audience after the amazing performance.
meanings.sent3: The bravos from the fans motivated the team to keep pushing forward.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was met with bravos that echoed through the hall.
meanings.sent5: The sound of bravos filled the air, showing their support.

meanings.sent1: His bravos in the face of danger inspired others to be brave.
meanings.sent2: Performing a solo in front of a large crowd takes real bravos.
meanings.sent3: The little dog's attempt to chase away the big cat was a display of bravos.
meanings.sent4: Facing the challenge head-on, she showed true bravos.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's bravos saved the family from the burning building.

meanings.definition: Plural form of bravo, used to express admiration or approval.
meanings.sent1: Bravos! You did an excellent job on your presentation.
meanings.sent2: The team scored a goal, and the crowd shouted bravos.
meanings.sent3: Bravos for finishing the race despite the tough conditions.
meanings.sent4: Bravos to the chef for preparing such a delicious meal.
meanings.sent5: As the curtain fell, the audience erupted in bravos for the actors.
